intro: Artabotrys hildebrandtii, commonly known as the white stork tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous white flowers that resemble storks in flight, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Annonaceae and is known for its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The flowers are hermaphroditic, possessing both male and female reproductive structures, which facilitates self-pollination.
